intro: Striga chrysantha, commonly known as the yellow striga, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and is often found growing on the roots of other plants. It is a hemiparasite, meaning it partially depends on host plants for water and nutrients. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on parasitic plant ecology and evolution.
